results.title: Sorok pervyy = The Forty first
results.brief_description:
Set during the civil war in Turkestan, ‘The Forty First’ is a remake of the story of romance with a Red woman commander and her captive White officer. In a remote region of Russia, skirmishes are fought between two armies in conflict. The conditions are trying - in the sand dunes of eastern Russia there are few resources for the embattled soldiers. A courageous sharpshooter, the commander is escorting her prisoner to his new confines when the two are marooned. Inevitably romance erupts between the enemies who are drawn into a struggle involving personal feelings and class identification. Remembering her duty, the commander makes a tragic decision, killing her lover in order to save him from capture, when the pair are rescued by Czarists. A typically patriotic Soviet drama from the 1950s that delves into an interesting wartime moral dilemma.

Credits: Director, Grigorii Chukhrai ; writer, Grigorii Koltunov ; photography, Sergei Urusevskii ; music, Nikolai Kriukov.
Cast: Izolda Izvitskaya, Oleg Strizhenov, Nikolai Kryuchkov, Nikolai Dupak, Georgiy Shapovalov.

results.title: Sophocles: Oedipus the King
results.brief_description: An Abridged version of Sophocles’ play performed in the 5th century BC amphitheatre at Amphiaralon by the Athens Classical Theatre Company styled on the ancient models. Narrated by Anthony Quayle, it features James Mason as Oedipus, Claire Bloom as Jocasta and Ian Richardson as Tiresias.

results.title: Sophie's choice
results.creator_credit: ITC Entertainment, Alan Pakula and Keith Barish
results.brief_description: Based on the novel by William Styron, this is a remarkably faithful adaptation of the original best-seller. Meryl Streep gives a glorious performance as Sophie Zawistowska, the tragic Polish Catholic beauty, who having survived Auschwitz, has settled in America after World War II. The time is 1947. Stingo (Peter MacNicol), a 22 year-old aspiring writer from rural Virginia, rents a room in a Brooklyn boarding house. He is drawn to his exotic upstairs neighbours, Sophie and Nathan (Kevin Kline), a madly romantic couple whose instability and flamboyance utterly capture this young man’s imagination. The deeper he delves into these people’s lives, the more he learns that each harbours terrible and terrifying secrets. This personalised view of the Holocaust and its devastating effect on one woman who survived it, is a shattering, moving experience.

results.title: Sooty & Co.
results.brief_description: Three episodes of the British children’s television series, “Sooty & Co” written and presented by Matthew Corbett. Sooty has been a well-known and well-loved hand puppet character appearing on television since 1952. This cute little bear with his magic tricks and mischievous ways, along with his companions Sweep, Soo and Butch, will entertain and delight young children of pre-school age. Combines puppetry and animation with live action scenes.

results.title: Sooty's Christmas party and other stories
results.brief_description: Sooty, Sweep and Soo have a splendid time at Christmas. They arrange a party with their friends and have lots of presents. Father Christmas makes an appearance in a most unlikely place! “Royalty” Sooty and his friends are visited by “royalty”. “Get your skates on” Sooty and his friends go ice skating. Written and presented by Matthew Corbett.

results.title: Soopergoop
results.brief_description: Rodney, a raffish cat, is an actor in an animated TV commercial who proudly reveals the process of promoting ‘Soopergoop’, a new breakfast cereal. The commercial aims and selling techniques which are used are revealed in a most amusing manner. Shows how children are exploited by appealing to their desires and how they are manipulated to persuade their parents to buy the fictitious breakfast cereal “Soopergoop”. Suitable for upper primary and secondary levels

results.title: Soon there will be no more me
results.brief_description: Her daughter had just been born and Lyn Helton was still 19 years old when whe learned that she had a fatal type of cancer. In whatever time she had left, Lyn was determined to write a book of hope to be left to the world. Most of all it would be a way to communicate with her daughter who some day would want to know the mother she couldn’t remember. The soundtrack of the film consists of excerpts from Lyn’s unfinished book.

results.title: Sons of the Anzacs 1939-1945
results.creator_credit: Australian Commonwealth Film Unit, Australian War Memorial and Frank Bagnall
results.brief_description: Shows scenes of the Australian forces in the principal campaigns of World War II, from the Middle East to New Guinea and the Pacific, with special reference to Tobruk and the Kokoda Trail. Includes archival footage and newsreels.
